trans-unit.source: Azure Notification Hubs Secure Push
trans-unit.target: Azure Notification Hubs Secure Push

trans-unit.source: Learn how to send secure push notifications to an iOS app from Azure. Code samples written in Objective-C and C#.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to send secure push notifications to an iOS app from Azure. Code samples written in Objective-C and C#.

trans-unit.source: Azure Notification Hubs Secure Push
trans-unit.target: Azure Notification Hubs Secure Push

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: Push notification support in Microsoft Azure enables you to access an easy-to-use, multiplatform, and scaled-out push infrastructure, which greatly simplifies the implementation of push notifications for both consumer and enterprise applications for mobile platforms.
trans-unit.target: Push notification support in Microsoft Azure enables you to access an easy-to-use, multiplatform, and scaled-out push infrastructure, which greatly simplifies the implementation of push notifications for both consumer and enterprise applications for mobile platforms.

trans-unit.source: Due to regulatory or security constraints, sometimes an application might want to include something in the notification that cannot be transmitted through the standard push notification infrastructure.
trans-unit.target: Due to regulatory or security constraints, sometimes an application might want to include something in the notification that cannot be transmitted through the standard push notification infrastructure.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial describes how to achieve the same experience by sending sensitive information through a secure, authenticated connection between the client device and the app backend.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial describes how to achieve the same experience by sending sensitive information through a secure, authenticated connection between the client device and the app backend.

trans-unit.source: At a high level, the flow is as follows:
trans-unit.target: At a high level, the flow is as follows:

trans-unit.source: The app back-end:
trans-unit.target: The app back-end:

trans-unit.source: Stores secure payload in back-end database.
trans-unit.target: Stores secure payload in back-end database.

trans-unit.source: Sends the ID of this notification to the device (no secure information is sent).
trans-unit.target: Sends the ID of this notification to the device (no secure information is sent).

trans-unit.source: The app on the device, when receiving the notification:
trans-unit.target: The app on the device, when receiving the notification:

trans-unit.source: The device contacts the back-end requesting the secure payload.
trans-unit.target: The device contacts the back-end requesting the secure payload.

trans-unit.source: The app can show the payload as a notification on the device.
trans-unit.target: The app can show the payload as a notification on the device.

trans-unit.source: It is important to note that in the preceding flow (and in this tutorial), we assume that the device stores an authentication token in local storage, after the user logs in.
trans-unit.target: It is important to note that in the preceding flow (and in this tutorial), we assume that the device stores an authentication token in local storage, after the user logs in.

trans-unit.source: This guarantees a completely seamless experience, as the device can retrieve the notification’s secure payload using this token.
trans-unit.target: This guarantees a completely seamless experience, as the device can retrieve the notification’s secure payload using this token.

trans-unit.source: If your application does not store authentication tokens on the device, or if these tokens can be expired, the device app, upon receiving the notification should display a generic notification prompting the user to launch the app.
trans-unit.target: If your application does not store authentication tokens on the device, or if these tokens can be expired, the device app, upon receiving the notification should display a generic notification prompting the user to launch the app.

trans-unit.source: The app then authenticates the user and shows the notification payload.
trans-unit.target: The app then authenticates the user and shows the notification payload.

trans-unit.source: This Secure Push tutorial shows how to send a push notification securely.
trans-unit.target: This Secure Push tutorial shows how to send a push notification securely.

trans-unit.source: The tutorial builds on the Notify Users tutorial, so you should complete the steps in that tutorial first.
trans-unit.target: The tutorial builds on the Notify Users tutorial, so you should complete the steps in that tutorial first.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial assumes that you have created and configured your notification hub as described in <link><linkText>Getting Started with Notification Hubs (iOS)</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial assumes that you have created and configured your notification hub as described in <link><linkText>Getting Started with Notification Hubs (iOS)</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Modify the iOS project
trans-unit.target: Modify the iOS project

trans-unit.source: Now that you modified your app back-end to send just the id of a notification, you have to change your iOS app to handle that notification and call back your back-end to retrieve the secure message to be displayed.
trans-unit.target: Now that you modified your app back-end to send just the id of a notification, you have to change your iOS app to handle that notification and call back your back-end to retrieve the secure message to be displayed.

trans-unit.source: To achieve this goal, we have to write the logic to retrieve the secure content from the app back-end.
trans-unit.target: To achieve this goal, we have to write the logic to retrieve the secure content from the app back-end.

trans-unit.source: In AppDelegate.m, make sure the app registers for silent notifications so it processes the notification id sent from the backend.
trans-unit.target: In AppDelegate.m, make sure the app registers for silent notifications so it processes the notification id sent from the backend.

trans-unit.source: Add the UIRemoteNotificationTypeNewsstandContentAvailability option in didFinishLaunchingWithOptions:
trans-unit.target: Add the UIRemoteNotificationTypeNewsstandContentAvailability option in didFinishLaunchingWithOptions:

trans-unit.source: In your AppDelegate.m add an implementation section at the top with the following declaration:
trans-unit.target: In your AppDelegate.m add an implementation section at the top with the following declaration:

trans-unit.source: Then add in the implementation section the following code, substituting the placeholder {back-end endpoint} with the endpoint for your back-end obtained previously:
trans-unit.target: Then add in the implementation section the following code, substituting the placeholder {back-end endpoint} with the endpoint for your back-end obtained previously:

trans-unit.source: Now we have to handle the incoming notification and use the method above to retrieve the content to display.
trans-unit.target: Now we have to handle the incoming notification and use the method above to retrieve the content to display.

trans-unit.source: First, we have to enable your iOS app to run in the background when receiving a push notification.
trans-unit.target: First, we have to enable your iOS app to run in the background when receiving a push notification.

trans-unit.source: In XCode, select your app project on the left panel, then click your main app target in the Targets section from the central pane.
trans-unit.target: In XCode, select your app project on the left panel, then click your main app target in the Targets section from the central pane.

trans-unit.source: Then click your Capabilities tab at the top of your central pane, and check the Remote Notifications checkbox.
trans-unit.target: Then click your Capabilities tab at the top of your central pane, and check the Remote Notifications checkbox.

trans-unit.source: In AppDelegate.m add the following method to handle push notifications:
trans-unit.target: In AppDelegate.m add the following method to handle push notifications:

trans-unit.source: Note that it is preferable to handle the cases of missing authentication header property or rejection by the back-end.
trans-unit.target: Note that it is preferable to handle the cases of missing authentication header property or rejection by the back-end.

trans-unit.source: The specific handling of these cases depend mostly on your target user experience.
trans-unit.target: The specific handling of these cases depend mostly on your target user experience.

trans-unit.source: One option is to display a notification with a generic prompt for the user to authenticate to retrieve the actual notification.
trans-unit.target: One option is to display a notification with a generic prompt for the user to authenticate to retrieve the actual notification.

trans-unit.source: Run the Application
trans-unit.target: Run the Application

trans-unit.source: To run the application, do the following:
trans-unit.target: To run the application, do the following:

trans-unit.source: In XCode, run the app on a physical iOS device (push notifications will not work in the simulator).
trans-unit.target: In XCode, run the app on a physical iOS device (push notifications will not work in the simulator).

trans-unit.source: In the iOS app UI, enter a username and password.
trans-unit.target: In the iOS app UI, enter a username and password.

trans-unit.source: These can be any string, but they must be the same value.
trans-unit.target: These can be any string, but they must be the same value.

trans-unit.source: In the iOS app UI, click Log in.
trans-unit.target: In the iOS app UI, click Log in.

trans-unit.source: Then click Send push.
trans-unit.target: Then click Send push.

trans-unit.source: You should see the secure notification being displayed in your notification center.
trans-unit.target: You should see the secure notification being displayed in your notification center.
